struct.name: ProductData
struct.description: Represents an Ericsson software product. The product name, product number, and product revision represent product information stored in PRIM realization part.

structMember.name: description
structMember.description: Free text description of the product.

structMember.name: type
structMember.description: Free text description of the product type.

structMember.name: cleartext
structMember.description: Indicates whether or not the password is entered in cleartext.

structMember.name: password
structMember.description: Holds the password or passphrase text.

struct.name: AsyncActionProgress
struct.description: Records the progress of an asynchronous action.

structMember.name: actionName
structMember.description: Name of the invoked asynchronous action.

structMember.name: additionalInfo
structMember.description: Used for logging significant messages during execution of an action.

structMember.name: progressInfo
structMember.description: Textual information that describes the actual state of the action execution.

structMember.name: progressPercentage
structMember.description: Progress of the action. The range is between 0 and 100.

structMember.name: result
structMember.description: Result state of a completed action. This field has value NOT_AVAILABLE if the action is not finished.

structMember.name: resultInfo
structMember.description: Textual description of the outcome/result of the action containing useful information for the NMS. If the action failed, it can contain an error message.

structMember.name: actionId
structMember.description: Uniquely identifies the invocation of an action. Identifies the invocation of an action when the managed object allows invocation of more than one action at a time.

structMember.name: timeActionStarted
structMember.description: Date and time when the current action was started.

structMember.name: timeActionCompleted
structMember.description: Date and time when the action was completed (successfully or unsuccessfully).

structMember.name: timeOfLastStatusUpdate
structMember.description: Date and time when the struct member state was last updated.

enum.name: BrmBackupStatus
enum.description: Indicates the status of a Backup. The status is INCOMPLETE during creation or deletion of a backup. Once a backup is successfully created, its status is COMPLETE. If the integrity of the backup is violated, it is marked as CORRUPTED.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_COMPLETE
enumMember.description: The backup is complete and can be safely restored.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_INCOMPLETE
enumMember.description: The backup is incomplete. The reason can be failure during creation or deletion. An incomplete backup can never be restored. The only operation permitted on an incomplete backup is to delete it.

enumMember.name: BRM_BACKUP_CORRUPTED
enumMember.description: The backup is corrupted. A corrupted backup is never allowed to be restored. The only operation permitted on a corrupted backup is to delete it.

enum.name: BasicAdmState
enum.description: Basic administrative states for a resource.

enumMember.name: LOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively prohibited from performing services for its users.

enumMember.name: UNLOCKED
enumMember.description: The resource is administratively permitted to perform services for its users. This is independent of its inherent operability.

enum.name: BrmManualBackupAutoDelete
enum.description: Indicates whether or not the implementation of BRM automatically does the housekeeping of manual backups.

enum.name: ActionResultType
enum.description: Lists the different results of an action.

enumMember.name: SUCCESS
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with success.

enumMember.name: FAILURE
enumMember.description: The asynchronous action ended with failure.

enumMember.name: MANUAL
enumMember.description: Backup created via a manual operation. A backup of this creation type is subject to housekeeping based on "maximum number" defined in BrmBackupHousekeeping MO and "remove-oldest" policy.

enumMember.name: SCHEDULED
enumMember.description: Backup created automatically based on a preconfigured schedule. A backup of this creation type is subject to housekeeping based on "maximum number" defined in BrmBackupScheduler MO and "remove-oldest" policy

enumMember.name: SYSTEM_CREATED
enumMember.description: Backup automatically created by the managed element. A backup of this creation type is not subject to any housekeeping policy defined by the management system and can only be removed by the managed element. Such a backup is primarily used for automatic recovery from catastrophic failures, but may also be used as any other backup if the management system chooses to restore the managed element with it.

enum.name: BrmDeactivatePostAction
enum.description: Indicates what to do in the post action phase of the deactivate step. NOP means no operation. CLEAR_LIST means clear the restoreEscalationList.

enumMember.name: ADD_BACKUP_TO_LIST
enumMember.description: Add the backup to the restoreEscalationList.

enum.name: BrmAutoExport
enum.description: Indicates whether or not a scheduled backup is automatically exported at successful creation.

enum.name: UsageState
enum.description: The usage state describes the usage of a resource. The allowed values are defined by ITU-T X.731.

enumMember.name: IDLE
enumMember.description: The resource is not currently in use. Defined by ITU-T X.731

enumMember.name: ACTIVE
enumMember.description: The resource is in use and it has sufficient spare operating capacity. Spare operating capacity to provide for additional users simultaneously. Defined by ITU-T X.731

enumMember.name: BUSY
enumMember.description: The resource is in use, but it has no spare operating capacity. Spare operating capacity to provide for additional users at this instant. Defined by ITU-T X.731

enum.name: DayOfWeek
enum.description: Presents the day of the week.

enum.name: DayOfWeekOccurrence
enum.description: The occurrence of a day in the month, for example the first Monday of the month. This is used in combination with DayOfWeek to schedule an event on a certain occurence of that day in the month, for example first Monday or last Friday of the month.

enumMember.name: RUNNING
enumMember.description: The execution of the action is currently in progress.

enumMember.name: CANCELLED
enumMember.description: The action has been cancelled and cancellation has been done.

derivedDataType.name: EcimEmpty
derivedDataType.description: Represents a leaf that has no value, it conveys information by its presence or absence.

derivedDataType.name: EcimBackupNameString
derivedDataType.description: String type of the backup name prefix.

rule.exceptionText: Must only contain uppercase or lowercase letters, digits, underscore, dot, or hyphen characters.
rule.name: Pattern Constraint

derivedDataType.name: BrmActionInvocationResult
derivedDataType.description:
Indicates whether an asynchronous operation was successfully invoked. (The actual result of the operation will be communicated by other means.)
A value of zero indicates success. Non-zero error codes are implementation-specific.

derivedDataType.name: Time
derivedDataType.description: Represents the international standard for the representation of local time (ISO 8601). The following pattern describes the Time format: hh:mm:ss Where: hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed)

derivedDataType.name: Month
derivedDataType.description: Represents a month in digits. The string format is "M" or "MM" (excluding quotes). M or MM = One or two digit month (1 or 0 1=January, and so on) 0 denotes all months.

derivedDataType.name: ActionInvocationResult
derivedDataType.description: This is the datatype for the Asychronous Action Id.

derivedDataType.name: DateTime
derivedDataType.description:
Represents the international standard for the representation of date and time ( ISO 8601). The string format is "YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.SSSZ" (excluding quotes). A DateTime string consists of a date part, a time part, and an optional time zone information part. The time zone part may be a "Z", representing the Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone (equals to +00) or a time zone offset (for example, +02:00). If the time zone part is not present, the DateTime value represents local time.
The following pattern describes the DateTime format: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss[.S+][Z|+-hh:mm] Where: YYYY = Four digit year MM = Two digit month (01=January, and so on) DD = Two digit day of month (01 through 31) T = Time designator (shows start of time component) hh = Two digits of hour (00 through 23, AM/PM not allowed) mm = Two digits of minute (00 through 59) ss = Two digits of second (00 through 59, leap second not allowed) S+ = One or more digits of decimal fraction of a second Z = Time is UTC +- = + or - character indicating positive or negative offset to UTC
DateTime values are compliant with ISO 8601 "Representation of dates and times" but are restricted according to RFC 3339 "Date and Time on the Internet: Timestamps". The DateTime format is further restricted as follows: - T and Z designators are upper case. - . (dot) is used to indicate start of fractions of seconds (ISO 8601 also allows comma)

derivedDataType.name: DayOfMonth
derivedDataType.description: Represents a day in the month in digits. The string format is "D" or "DD"(excluding quotes). D or DD = One or two digit day (1 through 31) 0 denotes all days.

class.name: BrM
class.description:
ECIM Backup and Restore Management top-level class.
ECIM BRM encompasses all the operations associated with the backup and restore of the managed element.

attribute.name: brMId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: exportPackageLabelPrefix
attribute.description: Free text to help better identify a backup export package when residing outside the ME. If specified, BRM prefixes this text to the label that it generates for the backup export package.

class.name: BrmBackupManager
class.description:
Serves as container for Backup instances of a particular backupType and backupDomain.
This class also provides the actions for creating new backups, importing backups from other locations, and deleting existing backups of the corresponding type and domain.

action.name: createBackup
action.description: Create a new backup of the backupType and backupDomain managed by this BackupManager. This is an asynchronous action - the progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the backup to create. If specified, input name validation is done by the implementation to forbid illegal names. Backup name validation rules are defined by the implementation and include duplicate backup names, names exceeding maximum allowed length, etc. If not specified, the implementation will generate a backup name automatically with format defined by the implementation, example: <managedElementId>_<YYYY-MM-DDThh-mm-ss>.

action.name: deleteBackup
action.description: Delete a backup specified by its name and the backupType and backupDomain managed by this BackupManager. This is an asynchronous action. The progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: The name of the backup to delete.

action.name: cancelCurrentAction
action.description: Cancel an ongoing asynchronous createBackup, deleteBackup, or importBackup operation.

action.name: importBackup
action.description: Import a backup using the specified resource identifier (uri). This is an asynchronous action where the progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute. Note that the type and domain of the backup to be imported must match the backup type and domain indicated by the instance of the backup manager on which this action is invoked.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: Specifies the location (url) of the backup to import or the resource name (urn) that encapsulates the backup import procedure.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password required to access the location specified by the uri. If no password is required, this parameter may be omitted.

attribute.name: brmBackupManagerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: backupType
attribute.description: Type of backup, for example System Data or User Data.

attribute.name: backupDomain
attribute.description: Backup domain, for example System.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of the ongoing (asynchronous) action, for example createBackup. This MO supports only one action to be executed at a time.

attribute.name: autoExport
attribute.description: Determines whether a manual backup is to be automatically exported at successful creation. If set to ENABLED, the manual backup most recently created is exported to the location specified by attribute autoExportUri after it is successfully created. Note that the automatic export is only triggered if creation of the manual backup was successful. Otherwise, no export operation is triggered, even if this attribute is set to ENABLED. Also, note that setting this attribute to ENABLED has no impact on the manual backups that were already created and stored prior to the new configuration.

attribute.name: autoExportUri
attribute.description: Uri used by the backup scheduler when automatically exporting a manual backup. If attribute autoExport is set to ENABLED, this uri specifies the location to which the manual backup is automatically exported.

attribute.name: autoExportPassword
attribute.description: Password used by the backup scheduler when automatically exporting a manual backup. If attribute autoExport is set to ENABLED, this password is used for authentication when automatically exporting the manual backup. No need to specify this attribute if no password is required for accessing auroExportUri.

attribute.name: manualBackupName
attribute.description: Used as a prefix for the name of the manual backup. The backups are named <manualBackupName>-<creation date and time> if manualBackupName is not the empty string. The default value is the empty string. If used the name must only contain lower case, upper case, digits, hypen, underscore or dot characters.

class.name: BrmBackup
class.description: Represents one backup of the type and domain specified by the BrmBackupManager in which it is contained.

action.name: restore
action.description: Restore from this backup. This is an asynchronous action - progress and result are reported in the progressReport attribute.
action.disturbances: Invoking this action causes board restart and loss of traffic.

action.name: cancelCurrentAction
action.description: Cancel an ongoing asynchronous restore or export operation.

action.name: export
action.description: Export the backup using the specified resource identifier (uri). This is an asynchronous action. Progress and the result are reported in the progressReport attribute. Note: When backup successfully completed, a copy of the backup is transferred and the original backup remains in the ME.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: Specifies the location (url) where the backup is to be exported or the resource name (urn) that encapsulates the backup export procedure.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: The password required to access the location specified by the uri. If no password is required, this parameter may be omitted.

attribute.name: brmBackupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: backupName
attribute.description: Backup name, provided by the operator.

attribute.name: creationTime
attribute.description: Date and time when the backup was created, i.e., start time of backup procedure.

attribute.name: status
attribute.description: Status of the backup.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of the ongoing (asynchronous) action in this MO, for example restore. This MO supports only one action to be executed at a time.

attribute.name: creationType
attribute.description: Creation type; whether manually created or automatically via BrmBackupScheduler.

attribute.name: swVersion
attribute.description: The administrative data portion of active software versions as specified in the software inventory management, when the backup is created.

class.name: BrmSingleEvent
class.description: A single scheduled backup event. This construct can be used to configure a single, one-shot, scheduled backup event by specifying the desired date and time.

attribute.name: brmSingleEventId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: scheduledTime
attribute.description: Scheduled time.

class.name: BrmPeriodicEvent
class.description: Periodic backup event. This construct can be used to configure a periodic scheduled backup event by specifying the number of months, weeks, days, hours, or minutes. For instance, in order to configure a scheduled backup event to occur every 12 hours, the following setup must be done: hours = 12. If more than one attribute is set, the values are added when calculating the next scheduled event. For example, if hours = 6 and minutes = 30, the scheduled backup event occurs every 6 hour and 30 minutes. The start time for calculating scheduled events is assumed to be the current system time by default, unless explicitly set using the startTime attribute. Furthermore, if the configured event is to stop at a specific date, attribute stopTime must be set accordingly. Note that the default value of stopTime is the end of a century. Daylight saving adjustments in Spring and Fall are addressed in such a way that the affected scheduled backup events are triggered exactly once only

attribute.name: brmPeriodicEventId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: months
attribute.description: Deprecated, The number of months. Replaced by CalendarBasedPeriodicEvent.month.
attribute.statusInformation: Deprecated. Use calendar based periodic events for a longer schedule than weeks.

attribute.name: weeks
attribute.description: The number of weeks.

attribute.name: days
attribute.description: The number of days.

attribute.name: hours
attribute.description: The number of hours.

attribute.name: minutes
attribute.description: The number of minutes.

attribute.name: startTime
attribute.description: Start time. It is an optional attribute. If not specified, the implementation uses the current system time as the default value.

attribute.name: stopTime
attribute.description: Stop time. It is an optional attribute. The default value is the end of the century.

class.name: BrmBackupHousekeeping
class.description:
Provides optional support for automated housekeeping of manually created backups.
If autoDelete is set to ENABLED before creating a new manual backup, BRM first checks the number of manual backups, and if the limit specified by the value of maxStoredManualBackups is reached, BRM removes the oldest manual backup before creating a new one.

attribute.name: brmBackupHousekeepingId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: maxStoredManualBackups
attribute.description: Maximum number of manual backups, per backup type, to store in the ME. When this limit is reached, if autoDelete=ENABLED, BRM removes the oldest manual backup before creating a new one. Otherwise an error is returned when createBackup() is invoked and the NMS must perform the required housekeeping activity before attempting to create a new backup.

attribute.name: autoDelete
attribute.description: Determines whether automated housekeeping of manual backups is enabled. If ENABLED and the number of backups already stored on the ME is equal to the value of maxStoredManualBackups, the oldest backup is removed before creating a new one. If set to DISABLED, no backup is removed. Instead, when action createBackup() is invoked, it returns a failure parameter.

class.name: BrmBackupScheduler
class.description: Provides optional support for scheduling backup creation. Each instance of BrmBackupScheduler MOC serves as the backup scheduler for the backup type indicated by its parent instance of BrmBackupManager. The scheduled backup events can be instances of BrmSingleEvent MOC, BrmCalnedarBasedPeriodicEvent MOC, or BrmPeriodicEvent MOC contained in the instance of BrmBackupScheduler.

attribute.name: brmBackupSchedulerId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: maxStoredScheduledBackups
attribute.description: The maximum number of scheduled backups, per backup type, to store in the ME. When this limit is reached, the oldest scheduled backup is deleted by BRM before creating a new one.

attribute.name: scheduledBackupName
attribute.description: The configurable portion of the scheduled backup name. The scheduled backups are named <scheduledBackupName>-<creation date and time>, where creation date and time is of type DateTime defined in the common library.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Reports the progress and final result of the ongoing (asynchronous) scheduled backup operation.

attribute.name: mostRecentlyCreatedAutoBackup
attribute.description: The name of the scheduled backup created most recently by the backup scheduler.

attribute.name: autoExport
attribute.description: Determines whether a scheduled backup is to be automatically exported at successful creation. If set to ENABLED, the scheduled backup specified by the attribute mostRecentlyCreatedAutoBackup is exported to the location specified by attribute autoExportUri after it is successfully created. Note that the automatic export is only triggered if creation of the scheduled backup was successful. Otherwise, no export operation is triggered, even if this attribute is set to ENABLED. Also, note that setting this attribute to ENABLED has no impact on the scheduled backups that were already created and stored prior to the new configuration.

attribute.name: autoExportUri
attribute.description: Uri used by the backup scheduler when automatically exporting a scheduled backup. If attribute autoExport is set to ENABLED, this uri specifies the location to which the scheduled backup is automatically exported.

attribute.name: autoExportPassword
attribute.description: Password used by the backup scheduler when automatically exporting a manual backup. If attribute autoExport is set to ENABLED, this password is used for authentication when automatically exporting the scheduled backup. No need to specify this attribute if no password is required for accessing autoExportUri.

attribute.name: adminState
attribute.description: Administrative state of the scheduler.

attribute.name: nextScheduledTime
attribute.description: The date and time when the next scheduled event is triggered. This is the earliest scheduled event from the set of configured events, i.e. single, periodic, and calendar-based periodic events.

class.name: BrmCalendarBasedPeriodicEvent
class.description: Periodic backup event using calendar-based interval. This construct can be used to configure a periodic scheduled backup event by specifying the desired interval using the calendar. For instance, in order to configure a scheduled backup event to occur every night at 2:00 am, the following setup must be done: time = 02:00:00. The start time for calculating scheduled events is by default the current system time, unless explicitly set using the startTime attribute. Furthermore, if the configured event is to stop at a specific date, stopTime attribute must be set accordingly. Note that the default value of stopTime is the end of the century. A scheduled backup event of this type is triggered only if ALL the conditions with regard to attribute values are satisfied. For example, if dayOfWeek is set to Monday and dayOfMonth is set to 1, the event is triggered only if the first day of month is Monday. Daylight saving adjustments in Spring and Fall are addressed in such a way that the affected scheduled backup events are triggered exactly once.

attribute.name: brmCalendarBasedPeriodicEventId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: month
attribute.description: Month.

attribute.name: dayOfWeek
attribute.description: Day of week.

attribute.name: dayOfMonth
attribute.description: Day of month.

attribute.name: time
attribute.description: This is the time when the scheduled event must occur.

attribute.name: dayOfWeekOccurrence
attribute.description: The occurrence of the day of week specified by dayOfWeek attribute in the month.

attribute.name: startTime
attribute.description: Start time. It is an optional attribute. If not specified, the implementation uses the current system time as the default value.

attribute.name: stopTime
attribute.description: Stop time. It is an optional attribute. The default value is the end of the century.

class.name: BrmRollbackAtRestore
class.description: Provides optional support for confirmation of a restore action or automatic rollback after an unconfirmed restore operation was executed. The existence of an instance of this class indicates that this feature is supported by the implementation.

action.name: confirmRestore
action.description: Invoking this action indicates acceptance of the previously executed restore operation. The restore supervision timer, counting down from the initial value indicated by the timeAllowedBeforeRollback attribute, is stopped when this action is invoked. If this action is not invoked before the supervision timer expires, the system is restored to the state it was in before the last restore operation was invoked. This is a synchronous action.

attribute.name: brmRollbackAtRestoreId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: timeAllowedBeforeRollback
attribute.description: Number of seconds to wait for action confirmRestore to invoke before performing the rollback to the state before restore.
attribute.disturbances: If this attribute is set, confirmation is needed after each future restore. Failure to confirm in time causes a rollback, which causes board restart and loss of traffic.

attribute.name: timeRemainingBeforeRollback
attribute.description:
Number of seconds remaining before rollback to state before restore.
Countdown stops when user issues confirmRestore action, or if any other OAM session is initiated. If neither confirmRestore issued, nor any other OAM session is initiated, before timer expires, an automatic rollback is triggered.
Automatic rollback is also triggered if the system restarts before confirmRestore.

class.name: BrmBackupLabelStore
class.description: Provides optional support for labeling of certain backups. This class contains attributes that help distinguish certain backups such as the last restored backup, primary restore candidate, and so on.

attribute.name: brmBackupLabelStoreId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: lastRestoredBackup
attribute.description: The name of the backup that was last used to restore the ME. This does not imply that the currently running version of the system is the same as this backup, but instead shows which one of the backups was last used to restore the ME. In a system that has never been restored using a backup, this attribute is empty.

attribute.name: lastCreatedBackup
attribute.description: The name of the last backup created. This backup can be MANUAL or SCHEDULED. Note that this attribute is not updated in the case of a failed attempt to create a backup, which would result in an INCOMPLETE backup.

attribute.name: lastImportedBackup
attribute.description: The name of the last backup imported to the ME. Note that this attribute is not updated in the case of a failed attempt to import a backup.

attribute.name: lastExportedBackup
attribute.description: The name of the last backup exported from the ME. Note that this attribute is not updated in the case of a failed attempt to export a backup.

attribute.name: restoreEscalationList
attribute.description: Specifies a list of backups by name, in the order that is to be used to restore the ME when needed. Specifically, the first element of this ordered list identifies the “primary restore candidate”. If the attempt to restore the ME with a given backup fails, the next backup in the list must be tried.

class.name: BrmFailsafeBackup
class.description: MO for activating and deactivating failsafe backups. Failsafe backups can be used when making changes to sensitive parts of the model, in which an error in configuration can lead to lost OAM connectivity or other failures from which the system can recover by a restore from a backup. When activated the failsafe backup function will automatically restore the system from a backup if the configuration as not been confirmed within a defined time period.

action.name: deactivate
action.description: Deactivates failsafe function and the failsafe backup is removed.

parameter.name: postAction
parameter.description: Optional parameter to perform post deactive actions. Values are NOP for no operation or CLEAR_LIST which clears the restoreEscalationList.

action.name: activate
action.description: Activates a failsafe backup, which is created when this action is invoked.

attribute.name: brmFailsafeBackupId
attribute.description: The value component of the RDN.

attribute.name: backupName
attribute.description: Name of the backup that will be restored in case the failsafe function is activated.

attribute.name: timeRemaining
attribute.description: The number of seconds that remains before the system is restored from the selected backup.

attribute.name: usageState
attribute.description: Shows if the failsafe function is activated or not. Multiple failsafe points is not possible, therefore this state is either IDLE or BUSY.

attribute.name: progressReport
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of creating backup for failsafe configuration. It will return the same information as the progressReport attribute of the BrmBackupManager managed object class.

attribute.name: timeoutLength
attribute.description:
The number of seconds the system waits before activating the failsafe function.
If the value is set while the function is active the timeRemaining will be changed to that time instead.

attribute.name: backup
attribute.description: Name of the backup that will be restored in case the failsafe function is activated.

attribute.name: progress
attribute.description: Represents the progress report and final result of creating backup for failsafe configuration. It will return the same information as the progressReport attribute of the BrmBackupManager managed object class.
